pr_title: [BEAM-10306] Add latency measurements to Python Flink load test

timeline.message: [BEAM-10306] Add load test with windowing and groupbykey
[BEAM-10306] Add load test with windowing and groupbykey
[BEAM-10306] Use event time for timestamps and watermarks
[BEAM-10306] Use event time for timestamps and watermarks

timeline.bodyText: Just out of curiosity, could you explain, why do we need GroupByKey in this place?
timeline.author: kamilwu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -147,10 +151,18 @@ def process(self, element, state=state_param):
               CounterOperation(
                   self.number_of_counters, self.number_of_operations)))
 
+    if self.window:
+      pc = (
+          pc
+          | beam.WindowInto(beam.window.FixedWindows(1))
+          | beam.GroupByKey())

replies.bodyText: The goal here is to test GroupByKey which holds back windowed values based on the watermark. This creates additional latency. If we do not use GroupByKey, then there is a simple pass-through of all elements without any buffer.
replies.author: mxm

replies.bodyText: I see. In this case, maybe it'd would worth to measure latency in GroupByKey Load Test: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/python/apache_beam/testing/load_tests/group_by_key_test.py? GroupByKey step is already there.
replies.author: kamilwu

replies.bodyText: Good point, I think we could move it there.
replies.author: mxm

replies.bodyText: I've removed the GroupByKey here and added a latency measurement to the existing GroupByKey test.
replies.author: mxm

timeline.message: [BEAM-10306] Advance watermark for windowing and state cleanup

[BEAM-10306] Add latency measurements to Python Flink load test

There are currently no latency metrics in the load tests which makes it
impossible to monitor latency regressions.
